column2: ND DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: North Dakota
column6: ND

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter
column6: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 2. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: move to the left lane.
column6: honk to let them know youâ€™re there.

column2: 3. This signal means:
column4: Stop
column6: Move to the left

column2: 4. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 5. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the left may pass.
column6: the lane to the right may pass.
column8: passing is permitted in either direction.
column10: passing is not permitted in either direction.

column2: 6. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column6: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 7. In general, you should pass vehicles going in the same direction as you are going:
column4: only if the other driver signals it is safe.
column6: on the left.
column8: whenever you have the opportunity to do so.

column2: 8. Emergency vehicles:
column4: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.
column6: may follow each other.
column8: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.

column2: 9. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.
column6: have no driving errors.

column2: 10. Regulatory signs:
column4: regulate the flow of traffic at school zone.
column6: provide information about the road rules and traffic laws.
column8: are diamond shaped and yellow or green.

column2: 11. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column6: in a tunnel.

column2: 12. Studies show that wearing seat belts:
column4: increases your chances of fatality in a crash.
column6: reduces your chances of serious injury in a crash.
column8: reduces your chances of damaging your car in a crash.

column2: 13. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column6: Drink coffee before driving.
column8: Take a cold shower before driving.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 14. Taking drugs and alcohol together:
column4: increase the risk of causing a crash.
column6: helps you get rid of the effects of alcohol in your body.
column8: is no more dangerous than alcohol by itself.
column10: has no effect on your general driving ability.

column2: 15. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 16. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
17. This road sign means:
column4: You must turn right
column6: Railroad crossing

column2: 18. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 19. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: No one.
column6: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column10: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 20. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Never depend on
column6: It is not recommended to check

column2: 21. A green arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations.
column6: means that you may go only if the green arrow is accompanied by a green light.
column8: is used only on one-way streets.
column10: means the same as a circular green light, but you must go only in the direction indicated by the arrow.

column2: 22. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: replace
column6: fix

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Highway entrance ramp ahead
column6: The right lane ends soon

column2: 24. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.
column6: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.

column2: 25. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column6: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
